Package mf

Class MessageBusController

  • java.lang.Object
    • mf.MessageBusController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageBus
    public class MessageBusController
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageBus
    The MessageBusController class represents the controlling class of the messaging framework. I is used for connecting and configuring all other objects used by the framework. The processing, sending and receiving of messages is outsourced to the other classes.
    See Also:
    MessageConverter, Forwarder, Receiver, MessageDeliverer, MessageIdStorage, SubscriptionService

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageBusController

        MessageBusController​(java.lang.String identifier,
                     int initialTimeToLive,
                     int messageCapacity,
                     int serverPort,
                     boolean forwardsMessages)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for a MessageBus. Nearly all the configuration happens with the constructor call.
        Parameters:
        identifier - Unique identifier of the main application
        initialTimeToLive - Standard amount of hops the package is allowed to make in total
        serverPort - Desired port used for receiving messages from other applications
        forwardsMessages - This message bus should forward messages to outgoing connections
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the message bus could not be created, because the network configuration is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the Identifier is not allowed

    • Method Detail

      • publishMessageTo

        public void publishMessageTo​(java.lang.String receiverId,
                             java.lang.Class<?> messageType,
                             java.lang.Object message)
        Allows to publish a message and therefore send the message to all outgoing connections. Only the receiver specified with the receiver id will actually read the message.
        Specified by:
        publishMessageTo in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        receiverId - Unique receiverId of a peer
        messageType - Class of the message Object
        message - Message Object. This object has to be an instance of the given messageType class
        See Also:
        Forwarder

      • publishMessageToAny

        public void publishMessageToAny​(java.lang.Class<?> messageType,
                                java.lang.Object message)
        Allows to publish a message and therefore send the message to all outgoing connections. This message is used, if the message is not addressed to a specific receiver.
        Specified by:
        publishMessageToAny in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        messageType - Class of the message Object
        message - Message Object. This object has to be an instance of the given messageType class
        See Also:
        Forwarder

      • addMessageResponse

        public void addMessageResponse​(MessageHandler handler)
        Add a class type to the subscription service. Messages of this type will be processed using the message handler
        Specified by:
        addMessageResponse in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        handler - Message type to which the application wants to listen

      • removeMessageResponse

        public void removeMessageResponse​(java.lang.Class<?> messageType)
        Add a class type to the subscription service. Message of this type will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        removeMessageResponse in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        messageType - Message type to which the application wants to listen

      • addConnection

        public void addConnection​(java.lang.String identifier,
                          java.lang.String ip,
                          int port)
        Add new outgoing connection. Messages will also be sent/forwarded to this connection from now on.
        Specified by:
        addConnection in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of a communication partner
        ip - IP address of the outgoing connection
        port - Port number of the outgoing connection

      • hasConnection

        public boolean hasConnection​(java.lang.String identifier)
        Remove outgoing connection. Messages will not be sent/forwarded to this connection anymore.
        Specified by:
        hasConnection in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of a communication partner
        Returns:
        Found a connection for the give identifier

      • removeConnection

        public void removeConnection​(java.lang.String identifier)
        Remove outgoing connection. Messages will not be sent/forwarded to this connection anymore.
        Specified by:
        removeConnection in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of a communication partner

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Allows you to stop all threads of the message bus. This operation should be called before terminating the program.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface MessageBus

      • processMessage

        public void processMessage​(java.lang.String receivedMessage)
        Internal function with the logic for processing of a received message. This method should only called by a Receiver object.
        Parameters:
        receivedMessage - Received message in json format.
        See Also:
        Receiver
